intro: Vittadinia, commonly known as the everlasting daisy, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are native to Australia and are characterized by their showy, daisy-like flowers that often retain their color and form for a long time after being cut. Vittadinia species typically have narrow, grass-like leaves and produce small, tubular flowers arranged in a composite head. They are often found in sandy or rocky soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Some species are cultivated for their ornamental value due to their vibrant colors and long-lasting blooms.
